intro: Petrocodon vietnamensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese rockflower, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, which helps in reducing water loss. Petrocodon vietnamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
